It was also possible to order drinks in the early evenings. We would recommend this hotel.

reviews.review_title: Great quiet place very near all Annecy activities
reviews.positive_text: The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, quite surprisingly, as all the other buildings were residential. It's very close to the train or bus station (10mins) and to the old town, without being noisy or disturbed by the thongs of tourists in Annecy.  The hotel has a terrace facing a nice and quiet backyard - several guests had breakfast on the terrace, and I saw some guests lounging under the trees in the backyard.  Breakfast was delicious, with variety between sweet and savory items. The room was a good size, with roll-down shutters which provided for darkness and further quiet; bathroom was a decent size, with toilet in a separate "closet", which is so French and wonderful.  The staff - all of them a delight!  The owner Sarah welcomed me with a huge smile, and spent quite a bit of time helping me with "the things to do around Annecy", while marking a map that she later gave me.  Throughout my stay, everyone was so friendly.  I loved the place!   One more thing: the hotel rents both regular and e-bikes by the day!
Could not fault any part of the hotel, staff really friendly, made our stay memorable
The staff were so helpful and attentive.

The room was nice, we heard a train softly only once in three nights/days! We especially loved the courtyard. It gave a sweet respite from town, where we read, wrote, and enjoyed a glass of wine before venturing out for dinner. Nice breakfast and very sweet and responsive ladies at reception. Highest recommendation!

Lovely room in a fantasticly located hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Handy to train station and easy walk to old town and lake. Ability to store bikes in secure garden area really appreciated.

reviews.review_title: Lovely friendly property close to town centre
reviews.positive_text:
A small and very comfortable hotel with a lot of very tasteful features and an expert personal touch / feel. Everything in the reception, small lounge and breakfast room was modern and stylish, quite obviously decorated and dressed by someone with very good taste.
Secure Parking was available in the hotels own private car park at the rear of the property.
The breakfast was typically French with good variety and everything of a very high quality. The staff on reception / breakfast service were excellent.
Our room was on the small side, exceptionally clean, with crisp white bed linen. The bed was very comfortable. Plenty of hanging space and hangers. Air conditioning. Bedside tables and lights. Shutters to the window. Tea and coffee making facility with herbal tea bags, no black tea with milk. The whole atmosphere in and around the hotel was calm and peaceful to say it was so close to the town centre.
15 minutes walk to the old town centre passing through a large shopping centre with shops like Zara made it an interesting walk. In the town centre itself there were also a lot of lovely boutique shops with clothes at reasonable prices, bars, coffee shops, pattiseries, etc. Overall it had a vibrant, bustling feel. 
There was no shortage of good quality restaurants ranging from ‚Ç¨15 - ‚Ç¨40 for a main course, right in the heart of the town, depending on your taste and pocket.
